description: From dys- +‎ -topia, as if from Ancient Greek δυσ- (dus-, “bad”) + τόπος (tópos, “place, region”) + -ία (-ía), based on utopia being reinterpreted as eu-topia.

nouns.description: dystopia (countable and uncountable, plural dystopia or dystopias or dystopiae)

entries.meaning: A vision of a future that is a corrupted (usually beyond recognition) utopian society.
A miserable, dysfunctional state or society that has a very poor standard of living.
(pathology) Anatomical tissue that is not found in its usual place.
examples: The patient suffers from adrenal dystopia.
